project.teaser: Travelling Ionospheric Disturbances (TIDs) constitute a specific type of space weather disturbance affecting the performance of critical space and ground infrastructure by disrupting operations and communications in multiple sectors. T-FORS aims at providing new models able to...
project.objective: Travelling Ionospheric Disturbances (TIDs) constitute a specific type of space weather disturbance affecting the performance of critical space and ground infrastructure by disrupting operations and communications in multiple sectors. T-FORS aims at providing new models able to interpret a broad range of observations of the solar corona, the interplanetary medium, the magnetosphere, the ionosphere and the atmosphere, and to issue forecasts and warnings for TIDs several hours ahead. Machine Learning techniques are used to train the models based on existing databases developed in the frames of past Horizon 2020 projects, to estimate the occurrence probability of medium scale TIDs and to forecast the occurrence and propagation of large scale TIDs. Prototype services are developed based on specifications from the users' community and following harmonized standards and quality control similar to the best practices of meteorological services. On ground demonstration tests are organised, by aerospace and civil protection agencies, to validate the performance of the T-FORS prototype services. A comprehensive architectural concept is proposed, including the densification of ground instrument networks, and new space missions, and possible future adjustments in order to develop a real-time operational service fully compliant and complementary to the ESA Space Weather services.
project.title: TRAVELLING IONOSPHERIC DISTURBANCES FORECASTING SYSTEM
project.keywords: Ionosphere, Space Weather, Space Situational Awareness, Travelling Ionospheric Disturbances

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Final report on T-FORS standards and quality control best practices
result.description: The report provides the T-FORS standards on data harmonization, and best practices for the quality control of raw data and of data-products, resulted from the assessment of the initial quality controls proposed in D1.2, following tests performed over the T-FORS models outputs.

result.title: State of the art review on standards and capabilities
result.description: The state of the art review report concerns TID detection experiments, detection methodologies and propagation models, and review on relevant standards adopted by international projects.

result.title: Results from on ground demonstrations
result.description: The report describes the on ground demonstrations and summarizes conclusions from the validation of T-FORS services usability for specific applications concerned.

result.title: T-FORS prototype
result.description: The deliverable provides the T-FORS prototype that releases preliminary services based on the WP2 and WP3 software codes.

result.title: Multi‐Instrument Observations of Various Ionospheric Disturbances Caused by the 6 February 2023 Turkey Earthquake

details.authors: Haris Haralambous, Marco Guerra, Jaroslav Chum, Tobias G. W. Verhulst, Veronika Barta, David Altadill, Claudio Cesaroni, Ivan Galkin, Kiszely Márta, Jens Mielich, Daniel Kouba, Dalia Buresova, Antoni Segarra, Luca Spogli, Jan Rusz, Jan Zedník

result.title: Updated D&E&C strategy
result.description: The report provides the updated plan for the D&E&C programme taking into account the latest developments from proposal submission to approval and considering the EC related services and the commitment of the consortium to use the Horizon Europe platform to make the T-FORS results visible after the end of the project.

result.title: Dissemination activities
result.description: The report summarizes the dissemination activities with emphasis on dissemination to conferences, to publications of the research outcomes, to the training of young researchers and to the feedback and impact.

result.title: Large scale Traveling Ionospheric Disturbances climatology over Europe for the period 2014-2023

details.authors: Antoni Segarra, David Altadill, Víctor De Paula, Víctor Navas-Portella

result.title: MSTID forecasting software codes
result.description: The deliverable provides the final version of the MSTID forecasting software codes, considering the results of validation with independent data.

result.title: Revised Data Management Plan
result.description: A revised data management plan will be released based on the results obtained from WP2, WP3, WP4 and WP6.

result.title: Multi-instrument observations of various ionospheric disturbances caused by the 6 February 2023 Turkey earthquake

details.authors: Haris Haralambous; Marco Guerra; Jaroslav Chum; Tobias G.W. Verhulst; Veronika Barta; David Altadill; Claudio Cesaroni; Ivan Galkin; Kiszely Márta; Jens Mielich; Daniel Kouba; D. Buresova; A. Segarra; Luca Spogli; Jan Rusz; Jan Zedník

result.title: Roadmap for an operational European TID forecasting service
result.description: The roadmap for an operational European TID forecasting service will propose the architectural concept including recommendations for WMO/OSCAR and ESA Space Weather Network enhancements.

result.title: T-FORS functionalities
result.description: The report provides the overall architecture of T-FORS, including data interfaces and processing chain, the policy for access and re-use, the data management and standardization requirements and the user interfaces.

result.title: Report on the MSTID alerts issuing system
result.description: The report provides the criteria for the MSTID alerts, considering outbreaks from the climatological pattern.

result.title: MSTID forecasting methodology and data inventory

details.authors: Mani, Sivakandan; Mielich, Jens; Verhulst, Tobias; Buresova, Dalia; Barta, Veronika; Belehaki, Anna; Altadill, David; Segarra, Antoni; Kouba, Daniel; Berenyi, Kitti

result.title: Refinement of project scales
result.description: The deliverable provides a more precise definition of the project scales, with quantitative targets and a planning for the evaluation of the scales in reference to the evolution of the project phases.

result.title: Exploitation activities
result.description: The report summarizes all activities implemented for the exploitation of the T-FORS results. It will provide a description of the Innovation Days, an analysis of the stakeholders’ profile who actively participated in these events and conclusions regarding the expected impact of the T-FORS services and possible further systematic exploitation.

result.title: LSTID validation results, forecasting accuracy and early indicators
result.description: The deliverable provides the validation results of the LSTID forecasting models specifying the accuracy and the early indicators used as input.

result.title: Final T-FORS services
result.description: Based on the remarks obtained from the on ground demonstration tests, the final version of T-FORS services is released.

result.title: Report on the MSTID climatological model
result.description: The deliverable describes the empirical model that provides long term forecasts for the MSTID occurrence, having as attributes at least the solar flux indices, the geographic coordinates, the season and the local time.

result.title: The March and April 2023 ionospheric storms over Europe

details.authors: Zbyšek Mošna, Veronika Barta, Kitti Alexandra Berényi, Jens Mielich, Tobias Verhulst, Daniel Kouba, Jaroslav Urbář, Jaroslav Chum, Petra Koucká Knížová, Habtamu Marew, Kateřina Podolská, Rumiana Bojilova
details.journalTitle: Frontiers in Astronomy and Space Sciences

result.title: LSTID forecasting models and preliminary codes
result.description: The deliverable provides a description of the LSTID forecasting models and a description of the software codes in a preliminary version.

result.title: Communication activities
result.description: The report summarizes the communication activities with emphasis on the Knowledge Hub structure, usage and feedback. A list of all outreach events where T-FORS participated and an analysis of the impact of the project appearance to the social media will be also included in this deliverable.

result.title: LSTID forecasting software codes
result.description: The deliverable provides the codes of the LSTID forecasting models with open access.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Elaborates the project strategy and operational model for the publication of data manipulated by the T-FORS consortium, based on the FAIR principles.

category.title: big data
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/computer and information sciences/data science/big data

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
